intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Ike, there's someone here claiming to be an envoy from the theocracy of Begnion. She's been asking if the princess of Crimea is aboard...What do you want to do?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: A Begnion envoy? How did she know about this ship?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Hmmm...Perhaps she had word from King Gallia...On the other hand, this is Begnion we're speaking of. I imagine it has spies in every corner of the continent. Perhaps one of those spies is the source of her information.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So we shouldn't be surprised that she knows about Princess Elincia, right?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: No, but it's extremely unusual for Begnion to send an envoy to meet a princess whom they do not even acknowledge.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: It is a complicated matter. You see, the envoy is essentially an extension of the empress herself. Both Crimea and Daein were once part of Begnion. Both nations have only recently splintered from the theocracy. I can't fathom why the empress would extend the courtesy of an envoy to a nation she must consider somewhat beneath her. She must be planning something.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Beneath her? That is somewhat harsh, don't you think?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Harsh, perhaps, but it's true. Clothing it in sweet words will not hide its bitterness, will it?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Soren, even I would question the tactfulness of your words.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I will try to be more diplomatic.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Ike, Nasir. You've no need to scold Soren. His words are just that. They do me no harm.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: I'm glad to hear that, Princess, but he should mind his manners.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Deciding how we ought to treat with this envoy is a more pressing issue. Princess, will you meet her and hear her message?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I believe I must. We gain nothing by refusing to see her. Let us meet with the envoy.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Princess Elincia of Crimea, I presume...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: It is an honor to meet you. My name is Tanith. I am deputy commanding officer of Begnion's holy guard.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I must ask, what would Begnion want of me that she would send her holy guard to greet me?

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: The apostle has learned of you, Princess Elincia, and she has come here to meet with you personally. The duty falls upon me to take you to her now.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: The apostle? Am I to meet--Surely the apostle has better things to do than...

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Will you accompany me?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I suppose that I...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We are the princess's escorts, and we will be coming with her. I hope you understand.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Then yes, I will go with you. Thank you.

intro.speaker: Pegasus Knight
intro.line: Bad news,ma'am. We've sighted laguz near the apostle's position. Birdmen. Crows, most likely.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Hmph! We've seen their kind before. They fancy themselves pirates without a ship, but they're thieves plain and simple. Commander Sigrun is with the apostle, and it will take more than a few winged scavengers to get past her. Let's remain calm.

intro.speaker: Pegasus Knight
intro.line: I... Actually, I'm afraid we aren't quite sure where the apostle is.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: What!? They've kidnapped the apostle!?

intro.speaker: Pegasus Knight
intro.line: No, no! I...From what the commander said, the apostle grew impatient and had another of her more...willful moments. I asked at the docks, and sure enough, one of the longshoremen heard her order the ship to set sail without us.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: What!? Where were her attendants? What was she doing without her guard? Why can she never just stay put? I've told her time and time again that the seaports here are rampant with pirates and crow thugs!...Right. Where is she now?

intro.speaker: Pegasus Knight
intro.line: The wind is poor today, so we think her ship should not be too far from us. I came here as quickly as I could.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Understood. We'll move immediately.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Excuse me, but is something wrong?

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Your Highness, I must apologize, but an urgent matter has arisen, and I must attend to it immediately. I will return for you later. Await my return!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What was that all about?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Judging from her expression, I'd say something has happened to the person she's meant to be protecting.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Say, do you think that ship over there is involved? The envoy is flying in that direction.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: If so, then the pegasus knight's fears have already been realized...They're under attack. It's the ravens they spoke of, isn't it?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike, why don't we go lend them a hand?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you feeling all right, Soren? It's not like you to offer to help anyone.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: It's a great opportunity to put the empress in our debt. We'd be fools to pass that up, wouldn't we?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I should have known you'd have an angle. What do you want to do, Titania?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I don't approve of Soren's motivations, but I agree that we should help.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, then that's what we'll do. Will you be all right on your own, Princess?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: You're doing the right thing. I would not dream of stopping you. I know those pirates are no match for your strength.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Give them...Give them a sound thrashing!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Huh...You're starting to sound like one of us, aren't you? All right then, we'd better go!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: My name's Ike. I'm with the Greil Mercenaries. I came to defend this ship--and the apostle, if I can.

recruit-talk.speaker: Astrid
recruit-talk.line: Is that so? I am Astrid, of House Damiell.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: A blueblood, huh? Well, unless you're good with a sword, you'd better hide yourself in a cabin.

recruit-talk.speaker: Astrid
recruit-talk.line: I'll do no such thing. I once trained with knights and cavaliers. I may be of noble birth...but I know something of battle. I can fight.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Well, if you can fight, we can use you. Let's work together. You going to be all right with that?

recruit-talk.speaker: Astrid
recruit-talk.line: More so than I would be with hiding belowdecks, certainly.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gatrie
recruit-talk.line: Lady Astrid! Are you all right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Astrid
recruit-talk.line: What do you mean? I'm fine. Why shouldn't I be?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gatrie
recruit-talk.line: I saw you talking to that rough, blue-haired lad earlier..What did he say to you? Was he rude? Did he try to tell you to run for safety while he fought for your honor?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gatrie
recruit-talk.line: Oh, what a fool! I tell you, he'll never learn! You already have an unbeatable bodyguard--me! I'll have to remind him of that later.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gatrie
recruit-talk.line: He is the son of a man under whom I had the honor of serving. He's not a bad person, by any means. But he has no manners whatsoever...

recruit-talk.speaker: Astrid
recruit-talk.line: I see. Well, he seemed more concerned than rude. When I told him I would prefer to fight, he seemed to understand.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gatrie
recruit-talk.line: Hm...Oh. Oh, of course! I see it now! How silly of me. Not rude, you say? I should have known my presence would have changed the boy for the better! I'm the ideal role model!

battle.speaker: Sigrun
battle.line: Finally! There they are! I hope we'll find Empress Sanaki...safe and sound...Ladies, chaaaarge! Show them what we've got!!

battle.speaker: Norris
battle.line: Pegasus knights? Begnion sent their holy guard here? Blast! Accursed crows...My plan was perfect! It's over...Men, into the seas! Swim for your lives! And if you get caught, tell 'em nothing! Not a word about our homeland, or your life is forfeit!

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Well, if it isn't Ike! Good to see you. You're looking well, my boy.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: Yeah.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Well, I'm glad to see it. I've been worried sick about how the Greil Mercenaries held up after I left. Did you ever recover?

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: We managed just fine. Uh...What are you doing here, anyway?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Me? Oh, I'm on a vital mission. Absolutely critical, I am. You see, these men keep attacking this ship, and I am to continue driving them back!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I see...Are you working for the Begnion apostle?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: No, no. My employer is far more charming!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: Is that so...From the sound of it, it must be a young lady.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Aye, after a fashion. Judging by the look of things, you must be on Begnion's side, yes? I certainly hope so. I'd hate to have to slay you after all we've been through.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: No, you're right. We're here to defend the apostle.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Well, that's a relief. There's nothing more awkward than having to kill a friend because of his poor taste in employers, I tell you. Still, I guess that's the hazard of life as a mercenary. It's good to see you, Ike. Let's finish this together!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I'm with you, Gatrie

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: Hey, Gatrie! What's with that sour look on your face?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: You know, I think it must be fate. Why else would we be here, fighting side by side once again? It makes me wish I hadn't abandoned you so quickly after your father, Commander Greil, died.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: It's not like you to say things like that, Gatrie...

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: You look like none of this matters to you. Aren't you mad at me or anything? I abandoned you all!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: No. I understand how you must have felt when you left. And it's only because you left that you met this nice new employer. I see no problem.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Yes, you do have a point. So I guess it all worked out! I can't believe I wasted all this time worrying!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: The fact that you worried tells me that you never really abandoned us after all.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Hm. You're right again! I am truly glad to see you, Ike.

battle-talk.speaker: Titania
battle-talk.line: Gatrie? Is that you? Well, I'll be. It IS you!

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Oh! Titania! It's been such a long time! How have you been?

battle-talk.speaker: Titania
battle-talk.line: Busy, of course. The mercenary life is a busy one. Have you been doing well since you left us?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Yes! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

battle-talk.speaker: Titania
battle-talk.line: My...I've never seen you so serious before. Whoever your new employer is, he must be quite special...or...would I be safe in saying she?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Tee hee! You know me too well! But I do love the work she gives me. I'm so happy, I don't know what to do! Well, it is nice seeing you again!

battle-talk.speaker: Titania
battle-talk.line: You, too. Good luck, Gatrie!

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Hm? Hey, it's you!

battle-talk.speaker: Soren
battle-talk.line: ...Hello, Gatrie.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: What's wrong? Are you still holding a grudge because I abandoned the Greil Mercenaries so abruptly?

battle-talk.speaker: Soren
battle-talk.line: No, not really. I'm just waiting to find out which side you're working for. If you're on our side, fine...Please fight till you drop. It will only improve our chances of winning.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: I, uh...Of course! You know, you can always count on me!

battle-talk.speaker: Soren
battle-talk.line: Hm. Always. Of course.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Phew...That boy hasn't changed a bit.

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: Gatrie? That is you, isn't it?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Well, if it isn't Mist! Long time, no see! How have you been?

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: Oh, you know! Hanging in there.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Look at you! You're out here on the battlefield now? How do you like it?

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: No worries...Not so far, anyway. How about you? Are you doing well?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Yes! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: I'm glad things are working out. I knew they would, but I was worried...Just a little.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Tee hee hee. You never need to worry about me, dear Mist. I've never been happier!

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: I'm glad to hear that.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Well, the battle awaits. Stay sharp, and stay safe!

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: The same goes for you, Gatrie!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: ...Well if it isn't Gatrie!

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Is...Is that you, Oscar!? My word, Oscar! So, how is it going?

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Well, I'm hanging in there. How about you? How have you been? Is everything going well with your job?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Yes! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: I'm glad to hear that. I knew you'd be fine, but I still worried about you.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Oh, there's never any need to worry about me. Why, I can't recall ever having been happier.

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Is that right?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: But enough chitchat. There's a battle to finish!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: You got that right.

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: It can't be...Gatrie!?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Boyd? Why, Boyd! Long time, no see! How have you been?

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: Since you left? I've been fine, thanks. We've all been just fine. Uh...What are you doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Working, of course! I'm on a very serious mission right now. I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: Hm. Well, I am glad to hear that. You do seem much happier now than when you were when you left us.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Ha ha ha. You always were an observant one. Let me tell you, I've never been happier.

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: If I know you, this has something to do with a woman, doesn't it?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Huh? What was that?

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: Oh, nothing. I was just talking to myself.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: But enough chitchat. There's a battle to finish!

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: You got that right.

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: Gatrie? It IS you!

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Hey! Rolf? Rolf! It's been a long time! How have you been?

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: Well...Yes. I've been well!

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: They have you fighting for them, too, do they...Are you doing all right?

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: Oh, yeah. I'm fine. I've been doing just fine. How about you, Gatrie?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Great! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: Sounds exciting! I guess I didn't need to worry about you after all.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: You were worried? That's nice, but to tell the truth, I've never been happier, my boy!

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: I'm glad to hear that.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: But enough chitchat. There's a battle to finish!

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: I'll second that.

battle-talk.speaker: Rhys
battle-talk.line: Hm? Is that...Gatrie, is that you?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Hm? Rhys? Rhys, look at you! It's been so long! How are you doing?

battle-talk.speaker: Rhys
battle-talk.line: Oh...I'm hanging in there. And you? How has it been since you left? Is the new job going well?

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: You bet! In fact,I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

battle-talk.speaker: Rhys
battle-talk.line: I'm glad to hear everything's going well for you. I knew it would, but I was worried...Just a little.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: Tee hee! You don't need to worry about me. Why, I can't remember when I've been this happy.

battle-talk.speaker: Rhys
battle-talk.line: I'm relieved to hear that.

battle-talk.speaker: Gatrie
battle-talk.line: But enough chitchat! There's a battle that needs fighting.

battle-talk.speaker: Rhys
battle-talk.line: Agreed. It's nice to fight at your side again, even if we're working for different people.

boss.speaker: Norris
boss.line: Blast! All my plans are falling apart. I'll cut you all down!

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: I saw this coming, of course. You know...If they'd just paid me more, I'd have been willing to lend a hand. Oh, well. What do a few human lives matter to us? They're none of our concern. We're done here. Let's go.

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: Yes, sir!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: That's it. It looks like the dust is finally starting to settle.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Looks like those crows took flight as soon as the holy guard arrived. The other assailants fled, too.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Then our job here is done. Crows are one thing, but what were those men doing with them?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Yes, I thought that was odd, too.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: They looked like pirates, but they certainly didn't act like them.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: True. They weren't interested in treasure, and their soldiers definitely were trained fighters. But who were they? Which country did they serve? Was this an attempt on the apostle's life?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: It's possible. The apostle is the symbol of the Begnion Empire itself. The apostle is its empress. If she were to perish, it's fair to say Begnion itself would perish as well.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I see...

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: The apostle is missing!? What do you mean!?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: That voice...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Something must have happened. Let's go find out.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: ...Ugh. This business is becoming quite the headache.

end.speaker: Begnion Soldier
end.line: I-I'm sorry, ma'am! If I can offer up my life in repentance for--

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Oh, stop it. If you want to repent, go do something useful and find the apostle.

end.speaker: Begnion Soldier
end.line: Yes, ma'am!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Did I hear correctly? Is the apostle missing again?

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Oh, you're that mercenary...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: My men guarded the cabin entrance. As far as I know, we kept it safe from the enemy...

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: From what I have been told, the apostle slipped out of the cabin on her own in the chaos...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: On her own? Now why would anyone called the apostle do something as stupid as that?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Hey, Ike! Watch your words. You're being rude.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: It's all right, dame knight. I have more important matters on my mind. I hate to ask, but would I be able to enlist your help in searching for the apostle?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Of course! You don't mind helping, do you, Ike?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nah.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: We'll search the enemy ship. Would you search your ship, just to be sure? I would appreciate it.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'll do what I can to find her, but I don't even know who I'm looking for...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I think it's safe to assume she will be a woman of stature, a noblewoman of some sort.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Huh.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Well, I suppose all I have to do is keep my eyes peeled for any stowaway--anyone I don't know. Let's split up. It will go faster if we search separately. Mist and I will check this side.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Then Soren and I will search the rest of the ship.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Soren...About what I said this morning...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: About the way you phrase things.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I...I ought to apologize for that.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, don't apologize. I know you. I know it's been bothering you, hasn't it?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: No. Well...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Don't take it personally. I'm no better, you know. Your ability to speak plainly the things others won't is part of what makes you brilliant. Others are too bound by courtesy...With you, I trust that what you say is exactly what you think.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Well...yes... Thank you, Ike.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Now, about that missing apostle...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You found her?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: No, I don't think so. But there's a child stowing away in here!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What!? What is a child doing hiding on our ship!?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: She must be some aristocrat's daughter. Probably slipped on from the Begnion ship...It was a hectic battle. She must have been frightened and hid herself here in the confusion. Are you going to help her?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Well, we can't just leave her.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hey, are you all right?

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I-I'm...fine...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hey, don't be scared!

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Uh...Wh-who might you be? You don't look like a laguz. Perhaps a new recruit?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No. I'm a mercenary. I was hired by Princess Elincia.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: The Crimean princess? Ouch!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What's wrong? Oh, you hurt your foot. Let me see.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Hold! Do not approach me! Hey, I told you not to--Oooouch! You're hurting me! You fool!!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Looks like the bone's not broken. Still, we'd better have Mist take a look at it just in case.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Oh? What? What are you doing!?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Just hush up and hold on to me. There's my sister. She can heal that foot of yours right up.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Are you trying to help me? Shouldn't you be elsewhere?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'm supposed to be looking for some sort of apostle person. But I think there are enough other people looking, and I'd rather help the injured first.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Ha...I see. This is indeed...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hm? What is it?

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Oh, nothing. If that's the case, I accept your help.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ike! Any luck finding the apostle?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nope. All I found was a little lost child.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Hey, she's quite a cutie.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mist, do you think you could use your staff to heal this kid?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Yeah. Is she hurt?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Just her foot...But maybe she bumped her head, too. She's been mumbling complete gibberish since I picked her up.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I kept silent, blaming these antics on your ignorance, but I can no longer tolerate your manners!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Huh? What's wrong? It's your foot, isn't it?

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Prepare yourselves, peasants!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Prepare? For what?

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: You stand in the presence of Sanaki, empress of Begnion! I am the apostle, the voice of the goddess!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Empress? What did she say?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What? Then she is...

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Oh, no... Is she really...?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, she can't be.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: No way

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Hold your judgment...Even if she's lying, there must be a reason...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Y-you...ignorant...!

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: Are you all right, Empress!?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: My apologies! We were unable to reach you, and we left you in terrible peril. I accept full responsibility.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: You're late, Sigrun! What would you have done had something happened to me?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Please, Empress, I beg your forgiveness.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: That won't be necessary. I am also partly to blame for what happened.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Let's focus instead on our rescuers. As a reward for rescuing me, I would like to invite them to visit our court. And be sure that the one they serve, that girl who claims to be the princess of Crimea, is invited as well.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Princess Elincia's bodyguards, I presume. I am sorry for the trouble you've gone to.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: And you are...?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: I beg your pardon. My name is Sigrun. I'm a commander of Begnion's holy guard. No word of thanks will ever repay you for saving the empress.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Wait...So it's true?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Are you saying that little child...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: is Begnion's...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Empress...Hm. It appears so. I can't say I quite believe it, but she seems sincere. Besides, how many people do you know who command a legion of pegasus knights?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: The empress has invited us to join her at Sienne, the capital of Begnion. I think we should go. Where is the princess? We should ask her permission before agreeing.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: She must be in the cabin. I'll take you to her.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Commander, how are you? Staring at the sea, I see...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I know you...You're Jorge, right? You make weapons for us.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: No. Jorge buys used ware. I'm his twin brother. Well, mostly his twin. He has blond hair, you see. My name is Daniel. Just remember that I have brown hair and that Jorge has blond, and you'll be fine.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Brown hair, Daniel, and weapons...Blond hair, Jorge, and items...I think I'll remember.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Fantastic. Say, can I ask you a quick question? You're a battle expert, right? You've fought a lot?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Enough, yeah. What is it?

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Picture this. Let's say there are two ships. And suppose there are planks connecting the ships at three different points.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right. I'm picturing it.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Now then, soldiers from one ship are about to attack the other one. Imagine that the defending side has fewer soldiers. If they want to mount a solid defense, what should they do?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It seems clear enough to me. Position the soldiers with the best defense on the planks, soldiers like cavaliers and knights.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: I see. So you would hold the enemy at bay by using your strongest allies to block the primary crossing points!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Then, you'd want to have your long-range attackers line up behind the tougher units barring the bridges. I'm talking about anyone with javelins, axes, or magic. You'd be able to do a lot of damage without much risk.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Sounds like a good plan but...it seems rough on the soldiers defending the bridges.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You would want to heal them often,obviously, but maybe there's a way to reduce how much damage they take.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: It's a stretch, but what if I don't have them attack at all? That way, they won't run the risk of getting any counterattacks!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hmm... That's not a bad idea.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Great! Thanks. That gave me some good ideas.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Ideas? For what?

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Oh, my brother and I have been playing a wargame. I've lost four times in a row.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A wargame?

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: We'll let you join if you bring some parchment and a quill. Come see us anytime if you're curious. See you later.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Maybe I shouldn't have been so serious with him...

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Well, well! If it isn't our commander! What brings you down here?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I was just on my way to the deck.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Oh, I see. That's too bad. I had a story I wanted to share with you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A story?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Hm mm. And quite a ripping yarn it is, too. Interested?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well... Not really.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Oh, you're so rude! And after you were so sweet the other day!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What are you going on about?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: When those crows attacked... I had wanted to see what they looked like, so I was hiding on the deck, watching. I had heard they could fly, of course, but I had no idea they could fight! I thought one of them had the drop on you, and I couldn't help myself! I cried out, Commander, watch out!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I thought I'd heard a strange, shrieking sound. That was you?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: And upon hearing my sweet voice, Commander, you turned around and brought down that crow with one shot! It was awe inspiring.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Not really. He was exhausted from the battle. He could barely move.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: And that's when you first caught my eye, my dynamic young commander!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Is that why your hand always lingers on mine when you hand me my equipment?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Oh, no! Have I been too...obvious?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Maybe I should send one of the others down to pick up our gear from now on...

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Hm. You're embarrassed, aren't you? You're so cute when you're being coy! But once I set my sights on a man,I never let him get away. Remember that.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hey.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: What do you want?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Is there any reason you're still on our ship? The crows are gone. The truce is over, isn't it?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: ...I have a duty. As a Daein soldier, I cannot allow a Crimean princess and her band of mercenaries to run free where they will.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: If you want to start a fight,you're on the right path. Think you can take us all on your own? Because if you want to get your friends, I won't stop you from leaving the ship.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Watching you all fight those crows like a band of street rats with sticks,I could see you were no match for me. But even if I were to leave this ship, the land is too far away for me to reach.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Nonsense. I can see land in the distance from time to time, and I thought you could go anywhere on that wyvern of yours.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: No wyvern could fly that far without resting, and these islands are thick with half-beast scum. Even if I wanted to, I couldn't leave this ship.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Then let me ask you, why did you follow us alone knowing that?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: I wanted to be recognized...I wanted my deeds to earn me fame. A soldier has little else to strive for...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And yet you soldiers sneer at mercenaries. At least we fight for something real. There are some dumb soldiers in this world.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You leave us no choice. I'll take you as far as Begnion.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: But as long as you're on my ship, you will not utter the phrase half-beast. If you can't agree to this condition, I'll kick you off the ship right now.

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: I'm just saying, there has to be something more we can do.

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Boyd... You're not making any sense. I understand your enthusiasm to help , but try to explain what you mean...We can't do anything until we know exactly what it is you want to do.

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: You're so impatient, Oscar. I was just getting to it, all right?

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Impatient? You're calling me impatient? You're so impatient you can barely be bothered to put your armor on!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Nag, nag, nag. Listen, I think we should come up with an unstoppable killer attack, something only we can do!

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: An unstoppable attack!? That sounds good...

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Doesn't it? I'm glad you approve, peewee!

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: Don't call me peewee!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: It is a fine plan, but you haven't explained what this new attack is supposed to be. How do we do it?

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Hey, I came up with the idea. It's your job to figure out the details. Make it cool, though, Oscar.

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Boyd, this plan sounds...Oh, dear... How do I put it?

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: Let me do it! I'll think up a great one!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: No way. Forget that. It's too much for your little peewee brain.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: I told you, don't call me that!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: They may not like to admit it, but they certainly are close.
